data.title: Resume: SOFTWARE ENGINEER
data.text:
[RESUME ANNOUNCEMENT]

Info:

=================

ResumeId: 1000069869

Position: SOFTWARE ENGINEER

City/State/Zip: SANTA ANA, CA 92705

Location: CA

Relocate: Y

Years Exp: 3/4

Salary: 50,000

Salary Type: YR

Position Type: C

Resume:

===================

experience in conversion using Lex & Yacc, C, study, design, development, testing, and implementation of application software using Developer2000( Forms 4.5, Reports 2.5, Pro*C ) Oracle 7.0/8.0, Oracle stored procedures, Informix New Era 2.0/2.12 Informix 7.0 Online under Unix, DOS, Windows3.11, Windows95 and Window NT 4.0 ( Platforms used: RS/6000, Pentiums ).

EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor Of Computer Science & Engineering , India with 71 % aggregate marks.

COMPUTER EXPERIENCE

HARDWARE RS/6000; PC 486; Pentium based PC.

LANGUAGES BASIC, C, PL/SQL, Pro*C, Informix 4GL, Informix SPL

ESQL-C, FORTRAN, PASCAL, NewEra 4GL, PROLOG & Assemly Language Programming ( 8085 & 8086 ), C++.

OS USED DOS 6.22, AIX Unix, Sco Unix, Windows 3.11, Windows 95, Windows NT

DBMS Oracle 7.0, Oracle 8.0, Informix 7.0 Online TOOLS

SQL Forms3.0, Lex & Yacc

PACKAGES Wordstar 5.0, Foxpro 2.0, FoxBase2.1, MS Office

CASE TOOLS Designer2000, S-Designer, Turbo Analyst 3.0

GUI Developer2000( Forms 4.5 and Reports 2.5 ), Informix New Era 2.0/2.12,

Power Builder 4.0, Visual C++ 1.52 / 4.0

COMMUNICATION TCP/IP

PROJECT TITLE # 1 MERCH, NationsRent Fort Lauderdale, Florida U.S.A

THE PROJECT : NationsRent is mainly into renting or retailing civil construction equipment. The Merchandising system has been mainly developed to take into consideration their business functionalities and store relevant information for the vendors and customers that they deal with, the item maintenance and inventory and the generation of fixed assets. I was responsible for the item maintenance and the vendor maintenance modules. My role was to read data from relevant tables and pass the information by generating strings that would be of a desired format and output it to a text file. This information in the form of a string would then be passed on to the stores section where they would read the file and they would check the validity of the string. The reason for building these strings was that the stores section are not having an Oracle database to store their information.

PERIOD Aug 1st 1998 till date.

CLIENT NationsRent, Fort Lauderdale Florida USA

LOCATION Fort Lauderdale, Florida USA

HARDWARE Pentium Servers and Clients.

OS USED. Windows NT on Clients, AIX Unix on Servers.

SOFTWARE Pro*C and PL/SQL stored procedures

MAJOR ROLE Team Member. Responsibilities included the analysis, coding and testing of the modules.

TEAM SIZE 4

PROJECT TITLE # 2 BANQUE NOMURA FRANCE

THE PROJECT: The project has been successfully completed and implemented. This project was developed for Banque Nomura France which includes Financial Accounting and Payables. Financial Accounting includes all the financial aspects related to a bank such as Voucher details, some banking concepts such as Bank reconciliation, creation and maintenance of current and clearing accounts. The Payables part included Invoices and its use in day to day transactions of trading with counter parties. All vouchers and invoices are then by means of a batch process posted to the General Ledger. Posting of vouchers and invoices are done on a day to day basis. At the end of the month, a monthly batch process is executed and similarly at the end of the fiscal year, a yearly batch process is run.

PERIOD April 15th 1998 till July 26th 1998.

CLIENT Banque Nomura France, Paris.

LOCATION Nomura Research Institute of Europe, London and Santa Clara USA

HARDWARE Pentium Servers and Clients.

OS USED. Windows NT on Clients, AIX Unix on Servers.

SOFTWARE Designer2000, Developer 2000, ORACLE 8.0, Pro*C, PL/SQL

MAJOR ROLE Team Member. Responsibilities included the analysis, design, coding and testing of the application software.

TEAM SIZE 4

PROJECT TITLE # 3 NOMURA BANK DEUTSCHLAND

THE PROJECT: The project has been implemented successfully. This project was being developed for Nomura Bank Deutschland which included Banking, Financial Accounting, Settlements and Securities. This project was originally developed using Forms 3.0 and was then converted to Forms 4.5. At the initial stage, all forms in Forms 3.0 were converted to Forms 4.5. After the conversion, bug fixing was carried out extensively. Some new requirements relating to the General Ledger were also requested by the client. I was responsible for the design, development of some new screens which were then incorporated into the existing system. Some reports were developed using Reports 2.5 and online requests by users were written in Pro*C. Later, did go over to Frankfurt for the implementation of the software.

PERIOD Jan 25th 1998 till Apr 15th 98.

CLIENT Nomura Bank Deutschland, Frankfurt.

LOCATION Nomura Research Institute of Europe, London. Pentium Servers and Clients.

HARDWARE Pentium Servers and Clients.

OS USED. Windows NT on Clients, AIX Unix on Servers.

SOFTWARE Designer2000, Developer 2000, Kumaran software, ORACLE 8.0, Pro*C, PL/SQL

MAJOR ROLE Team Member. Responsibilities included the analysis, design, coding and testing and implementation of the application software

TEAM SIZE 4

PROJECT TITLE # 4 SPML

THE PROJECT: The project was developed for a firm who are engaged in the construction of roads, buildings, dams, pipelines etc. The project is mainly divided into 5 modules viz. Pre-Tendering, Contract, Financial Accounting, Stores and Purchase, Payroll and HRD.I was engaged in the study and analysis of "Pre-Tendering" , "Stores and Purchase" and "Payroll and HRD" modules.The module namely "Pre-Tendering" deals with all tendering related activities prior to getting the contract.The "Stores and Purchase" module is related to Material / Equipment control."Payroll and HRD" module involves the payroll generation taking into consideration the employee details and other standard deductions ( Taxation details ) and benefits.

PERIOD Nov'97 to Jan 10th 97

CLIENT SMPL, India

LOCATION Techna Digital Services Pvt. Ltd., Calcutta, India.

HARDWARE Pentium Servers

OS USED. Windows 95

SOFTWARE Designer2000, ORACLE 8.0

MAJOR ROLE Team Member. Responsibilities include Analysis of the Application System.

TEAM SIZE 3

PROJECT TITLE # 5 Integrated Management System

THE PROJECT : The project has been successfully implemented and other centers of GRSE are also going in for a similar software. It was developed for a firm who are engaged in the manufacturing and assembly of ships for the defense sector. The project is mainly divided into three major modules i.e. Material Control and Quality Assurance, Financial Accounting and Production. The module namely Material Control & Quality Assurance will take into consideration the "Purchase", "Stores Management", "Quality Control" and "Inventory" related aspects of an "Order".The next module "Financial Accounting" deals with the cost related factors for the "Order".Finally, the Production module will take into account the manufacturing aspect of the "Order". Finite loading charts for the different manufacturing shops are being generated taken into account various parameters given by the user. The allocation is to be automatically done and an automated schedule is going to be generated.

PERIOD Nov'96 to Oct'97

CLIENT GardenReach Ship Builders & Engineers Limited.

LOCATION Techna Digital Services Pvt. Ltd., Calcutta, India.

HARDWARE RS/6000; Pentiums

OS USED. DOS 6.22; AIX Unix; Windows 95; Windows NT ENVIRONMENT Microsoft Windows for Workgroups 3.11, Windows 95. GUI

SOFTWARE Developer 2000, ORACLE 8.0, PL/SQL, Pro*C

MAJOR ROLE Team Member. Responsibilities include Analysis of the Application System and Design, Coding and Implementation of the system.

TEAM SIZE 4

PROJECT TITLE # 6 Manufacturing Scheduling System (MASS).

THE PROJECT : The project was developed for a firm who are engaged in the manufacturing and assembly of Electrical equipment. The project involves Analysis of a Production Scheduling System and Development of an Application System which will generate an automated Schedule taking into consideration all the parameters specified by the user. There were two modules for the project namely "Macro" and "Micro". Macro Scheduling at the upper level was related to a generalized approach in Production Scheduling providing a tentative automated schedule. The risk area was comparatively less than the "Micro".Micro Scheduling was carried out at a deeper level and the automated schedule generated was implemented within the manufacturing shops for day-to-day manufacturing. This project has been implemented successfully and is being used for all the shopfloors currently.

PERIOD Sep' 95 To Oct' 96

CLIENT SIEMENS India Ltd, Calcutta Works

LOCATION Techna Digital Services Pvt. Ltd., Calcutta, India.

HARDWARE RS/6000, PC486

OS USED. DOS 6.22, AIX Unix, Windows 3.11, Windows 95

SOFTWARE Developer 2000, PL/SQL, Pro*C

MAJOR ROLE Team Member. Responsibilities include Analysis of the Application System and Design, Coding and Implementation of the system

TEAM SIZE 6

PROJECT TITLE # 7 Conversion From AS400 To Informix

THE PROJECT : The Project involved the Conversion from AS400 to Informix using Lex & Yacc which was used for Parsing the DDS. The Parser was written in C.

PERIOD Jun'95 To Aug'95

CLIENT Techna Digital Services Pvt. Ltd., Calcutta, India.

LOCATION Techna Digital Services Pvt. Ltd., Calcutta, India.

HARDWARE RS/6000; UNIX Terminal

OS USED. AIX Unix

SOFTWARE Informix ,Lex & Yacc, C; ESQL-C

MAJOR ROLE Team Member. Responsibilities included writing the Parser in C using Lex & Yacc.

TEAM SIZE 2

PROJECT TITLE # 8 Conversion From PASCAL To C

THE PROJECT: The Project involved the Conversion from Pascal to C using Lex & Yacc which was used for Parsing. The Parser was written in C.

PERIOD Jan'95 To May'95

CLIENT Techna Digital Services Pvt. Ltd., Calcutta, India.

LOCATION Techna Digital Services Pvt. Ltd., Calcutta, India.

HARDWARE RS/6000, UNIX Terminal

OS USED. AIX Unix

SOFTWARE Lex & Yacc, C

MAJOR ROLE Team Member. Responsibilities included writing the Parser in C using Lex & Yacc.

TEAM SIZE 6

ORACLE FINANCIALS

Did Undergo a training in Oracle Financials. The modules completed were General Ledger, System Administration, Application Object Library (AOL), Assets, Oracle Receivables and Oracle Payables. The General Ledger module involves the complete definition of the set of books, Journal Entries and their details. The AOL module involved customization of existing forms and creation of application oriented forms. Exposure to Forms 2.3 ( CUI mode ) and Forms 4.5 (GUI mode ).

===================

This candidate is posted anonymously by <http://www.jobbankusa.com/>

In order to view contact information for this candidate or view

similar resumes please contact JobBank USA.

JobBank USA

since 1995.

[RESUME ANNOUNCEMENT]

Info:

=================

ResumeId: 1000070596

Position: SOFTWARE ENGINEER

City/State/Zip: HYATTSVILLE, MD 20783

Location: DC

Relocate: Y

Years Exp: 10/20

Salary:

Salary Type: HR

Position Type: PC

Resume:

===================

OBJECTIVE

To contribute relevant experience and education background to the position of a Application Developer/Software Engineer.

BACKGROUND

Extensive and diversified computer hardware and software knowledge in personal computers. Excellent Investigative and research skills. Self-taught in many Computer Science concepts, many programming languages, word processors, operating systems, database and spreadsheet software applications. Thorough knowledge in the development and implementation of computer programs, including formulation of preventive maintenance programs, institution of assembler modules, provision of technical support and customization of existing formats. Business knowledge and skills, like domain and industry knowledge, and architectures.

COMPUTER KNOWLEDGE

LANGUAGES: C, C++, Java, Pascal, Object Pascal, Assembly language, COBOL, PL/1.

SYSTEMS: Dos, Windows 3.11, 95, 98, NT, UNIX, AIX, OS/2, Macintosh/PowerPC.

HARDWARE: IBM, DEC, Compaq, Various PC's, HP laser and Epson FX printers, various Ethernet networking devices, CD-ROMS, OCR Scanners, Storage Dimensions E/O SCSI Drive, IBM OS 3090 mainframe, 370 DOS mainframe, RISC System/6000s, X stations, Token Ring Local Area Network(LAN).

OTHER: PSQL/DB, Oracle, SYBASE, Object Technology i.e. various object-oriented methodologies like OMT, Objectory, Booch and Shlaer-Mellor, OOA, OOD, OOP, Object Databases like POET and ObjectStore, DCE and CORBA, Software Engineering, MS Windows API, Various SDKs, MFC/OWL, STL and Libraries from Rogue Wave ie Tools.h++, and the Standard C++ Library, OLE, DDE, Visual Programming ie Delphi and Visual Basic, Client/Server Technology, PC troubleshooting techniques, OSF/Motif GUI Version control tools like PVCS and SourceSafe. Design tools from Rational Rose and UML. Internet Development(GUI, ISAPI, Sockets).

EDUCATION SUMMARY

1994-1995 P.C. SUPPORT ADMINISTRATOR PROGRAM

George Brown College-Toronto

1992-1993 COMPUTER PROGRAMMING AND SYSTEMS DIPLOMA

Career Development Institute-Toronto

1980-1988 BACHELOR OF SCIENCE DEGREE

MATHEMATICS/COMPUTER SCIENCE

Obafemi Awolowo University-Nigeria

AREAS OF EXPERIENCE

Apr 1998-Oct 1998

Software Developer Manpower Inc-Milwaukee

Development of a client/server application in

Delphi on Windows 95. Implimentations of stored procedures using PL/SQL on AIX. GUI development in Delphi. Involved in development on client side of application using Delphi.

Oct 1997- Feb 1998

Software Developer SNYTEL/Allied Van Lines-Naperville

Maintenace of a legacy system written in COBOL/CICS. Was involved in the development of a Batch System to interface with a legacy system. Utilized Visual C++ 4.0 and SourceSafe. Coding was in C++. Got involved with Rouge Wave Tool.h++ for processing EDI files. Used SNA for conecting workstations to mainframe. This involved the ability to connect a non-CICS to a CICS pplication. ECI and EPI which involved some screen scraping type of application program technique was utilized. Installed and configured Transarc/IBM's Encima and CICS for clients and server on Windows NT 4.0.

Mar 1997- Sept 1997

Software Engineer Advanced Health/Med-E-Systems-Chicago

Designed, coded, and tested changes for enhancements and fixes under general Supervision. Recommended solutions and Implementation approaches. Created technical and/or functional designs. Participated in resolving issues with vendor hardware and software. Reviewed design and code work form peers and developers. Developed a Template-Based Treewalk Application. Development was done on Windows 95. C++ and Windows Development(Win 32 Programming). Coding of RPCs using C++.

Sept 1996- Dec 1996

Software Tester/Debugger Ctg/Advantis-Schumburg

Tested and debugging an Interactive Financial System. Used makefiles to automate the Build process in building a Web Server. Applied Configuration Management and Quality Assurance to the Web Server using CMVC in an AIX Client/Server Environmant. Analysed source code written in C++ and Java. Analysed various drivers of the interactive Finantial System. Aided in the documentation of the Interactive Financial System. Wrote some shell scripts. OS/2 was used has the client interface to access AIX machines and servers over the network.

1990-1996

Independent Consulting/Software Engineer/Private

Tutor/Private Business and Development Assistance- Toronto

Developed a Windows Based Object-Oriented Drawing Program using Borland C++. Developed an Object-Oriented window class library using C++ and assembly code.Developed a Relational Database in C. Support PC tools such as Norton Utilities, Direct Acess, Fastback, and QEMM. Windows Programming at the API level to develop a database for storing book titles. Installed software for new clients and provided on-site support. Used MS Access and MS Excel to develop an address database application.

1993-1995

Programmer Analyst C & E Consultants-Toronto

Used compound SQL statements and stored procedures to reduce and reuse embedded SQL code to increase performance and productivity. Worked with a typical client/server Configuration for DB2: OS/2 client to AIX server. Used IBM's SOM to create desktop objects for the OS/2 Workplace Shell that used Distributed SOM (DSOM) to invoke methods on remote objects-all implemented in C++ using the Direct-to SOM feature

of IBM's VisualAge C++ compiler. Developed a text editor using Visual C++ and the MFC Library. Wrote a set of ISAM routines using Borland C++. Developed a Custom Payroll System using Delphi.

QUALITIES

The ability to work within a systematic and rigorous process.

Glean salient facts from spurious information.

Analyse a variety of problem domains.

Selectively apply sound engineering practices.

Apply rational thought and judgement.

Well developed interpersonal, presentation and communication skills.

Ability to use right pattens, balance engineering concerns with formal

constraints and wave a deeply human sense of aesthetics into the software development process.

References:

Veera Karthi: 773-286-7106

Steve Peczko: 630-717-3193

Ganesh: 630-717-3297

Joanne Wilson: 312-443-5840

Jim Brady: 847-706-1876



[RESUME ANNOUNCEMENT]

Info:

=================

ResumeId: 1000070962

Position: SOFTWARE ENGINEER

City/State/Zip: CAMPBELL, CA 95008

Location: CA

Relocate: Y

Years Exp: 3/4

Salary: $60K/yr

Salary Type: YR

Position Type: PC

Resume:

===================

Objective : Seeking a challenging position as a Software Engineer in an innovative organization.

Experience Summary :

3+ years of experience in analysis, design and development of systems and application software. Expert level knowledge of Visual C++ with MFC and MS-SQL Server.

Education :

BS Electronics Engineering 1994, July University of Poona(Pune), India.

Languages, RDBMS & Tools : VC++ (with MFC), MS-SQL Server, MS-Access.

Operating Systems : Windows NT, Windows 95.

Hardware Platforms : Pentium based PCs

Other Skills : Develop Custom Controls in MFC Extension Library.

Professional Experience :

Computing Technologies International, Inc.(CTI), San Jose CA. Since May '98

Software Engineer

We are developing software tools using Visual C++ on Windows NT with MS-SQL Server for productivity enhancements in electric power generation plants. Have clients in US, Sweden and Denmark.

Projects/Modules :

Diagnosis Tool -- Developed the User Interface for the Diagnosis Tool. The Diagnosis Tool evaluates unit and component performance degradation by using plant specific information and model based algorithms to detect worn equipment. Developed custom controls in MFC extension library

Environment: Windows NT, MS-SQL Server, Visual C++ 5.0.

Alarm Manager -- This is an interactive service that examines the state of the plant. It uses automatically generated data, including performance and diagnostic data to analyze plant conditions. One can enter particular unit, component, port and variables for Alarm Manager to monitor. It defines the plant circumstances under which an alarm is activated. It also determines the plant personnel who will receive the alarm notification. It is a multi-threaded application to monitor and display real-time data.

Environment: Windows NT, MS-SQL Server, Visual C++ 5.0.

EnergiTools India Limited (ETIL), New Delhi, India. April Æ96 - MayÆ 98

Software Engineer

Was developing modules of EnergiTools for Computing Technologies International, Inc. San Jose CA.

Projects/Modules :

User Manager -- This service allows you to set up user names, passwords and user class for the users using Energi Tools .

Environment: Windows NT, MS-SQL Server, Visual C++ 5.0.

Task Scheduler û This service provides a list of activities that can be scheduled to run automatically. Tasks can be scheduled for single or periodic execution.

Environment: Windows NT, MS-SQL Server, Visual C++ 5.0.

Report Viewer -- This service is designed to view and print Plant reports. Designed the templates using the third party software package SeagateÆs Crystal Report.

Environment: Windows NT, MS-SQL Server, Visual C++ 5.0.

MS-SQL Server Database Access Library -- Developed object oriented database access library, stored procedures required for performance enhancement and SQL scripts for database creation.

Environment: Windows NT, MS-SQL Server, Visual C++ 5.0.

Performance Tool -- Developed some of the user interface for Performance Analysis tool for electric utility. The tool is developed with a Client-Server architecture, advanced graphical user interface and extensive thermodynamic analysis methods to monitor and analyze the performance of a power plant.

Environment: Windows NT, MS-SQL Server, Visual C++ 5.0.

System Administration -- Setup the whole office under Server Client configuration using Windows NT through LAN. Installed all the required software. Maintaining the Windows NT Server and the local E-mail server.

Environment: Windows NT

Visual Source Safe(VSS) -- Maintaining the VSS for source code of the whole project.

Environment: Windows NT, Visual C++ 5.0.

Information Technologies India Ltd., New Delhi, India Jan95 - Mar æ96

Software Engineer

Good Par - A Process Flow and Job Flow Preparation Tool. Good Par helps the user in preparing and editing the Process flows and Job flows that are normally prepared by using Job Control Language (JCL). GoodPar is a GUI tool with full international language support and represents Process Flows and Job Flows in pictorial form. Designed the classes for visual objects to represent various components of the Process Flow and Job Flow. Responsible for designing coding and testing of the flow editor.

Environment: Visual C++ 1.5, Windows 3.1, Intel 486.

Personnel Information System -- This system manages the information of employees in an organization. Designed and created tables, forms and finally the installation program for the package. Extensively used predefined classes for stream based file I/O.

Environment: MS-Windows 3.1, Borland C++ 2.0.

Research & Defence Establishment India(R&DE), Pune, India Aug. æ93 - May æ94

Trainee Engineer

Top Level Research Institute under the Ministry of Defense(India). Developed the program for acquisition of data, compression of data(using compression algorithms) and transmission of data through modem.

Reference :

References available on request.


